House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Hi there, I'm looking for a responsible and considerate roommate (male or female). I have a furnished private spare 1 BR available for a roommate in a lovely home in the Brentwood area located in North Burnaby. I am the owner of the property and also reside on the main level of the home. I am a man, professionally employed with a full time career and I enjoy a quiet lifestyle.  The bedroom and overall living space of the home is suited for a mature (ideally 35 +) considerate person who is professionally employed, or a mature student. A person who prefers to do their socializing outside of the home keeping the home environment to be enjoyed as a tranquil and quiet space to relax and replenish one's mind, body, and spirit at the end of a workday. If your primary residence is out of town but you commute to work in Vancouver and you are seeking rental accommodation part time I am open to negotiating and possibly reducing the rent.

The house is conveniently close to public transit. Downtown Vancouver is only 20 minutes by car but is easily accessible by sky train at Brentwood Town Centre which is 5 minutes walking distance from the house. Shopping and restaurants in the Brentwood & Heights Neighbourhood are right at your doorstep. There are walking and biking trails near by, as well as Confederation Park and the Eileen Daily leisure pool & fitness centre. 

Must be very comfortable around dogs/cats, non-smoker (no smoking of any kind on the premises), no drugs, no pets. You prefer to keep your home environment clean and tidy and others describe you as considerate and responsible. If this sounds like you and you are interested in viewing the bedroom and living space please send me an email and tell me a bit about yourself. LGBQT+ friendly.

The bedroom is available now. If this advertisement is still up it means the room is still available.

*References required. 
*Month to Month Rental.

House Title: Room for Rent in a Brand New Two BR, Energy Efficient, FULL Amenities
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Ideally situated room in a two bedroom apartment, available August 1st!

The Burnaby Heights building, on 388 Skeena St, just a block away from the Kootenay bus loop, is an environmentally conscious dream come true!  The building's design is called a Passive Home, which means:

1) The apartment is properly insulated.

2) ZERO air leakages.

3) No 'Thermal Bridges'.  Which is when warmth from indoors is able to pass right through a wall.

4) Triple (3x) pane glass in all the windows!

5) Properly situated building to receive sunlight in the winter, and shade in the summertime!

So the heating bill is 10% of a typical bill - which is pretty nifty.

Also, Washer and Dryer in unit, of course.  Rec-room as part of the building available to book (free!), which features a ping pong table, very nice patio (BYOBBQ), suitable for small to medium sized social gatherings.  No TV in that area, but I have a projector that can be set up virtually anywhere.

Furthermore, the apartment features an HRV system. Which stands for Heat Recovery Ventilation.  This ensures that there is a constant supply of fresh air taken from the outside, without losing any of the heat from the inside! Neat, eh?!

Lastly, our building is affiliated with Modo car share, and you can receive a $100 credit with them if you sign up through the building. There's also talk of being a future site of the modo Bike Share program, down the road!

And there is a $150 move-in credit, which would be taken off your first months rent.  Security deposit of half-a-months rent required.
--------------------------

So that's the building, but what about me, your prospective room-mate?  Axe-murderer? Sorry, you'll just have to keep looking if your trying to snag an axe-murderer as a roomie. Best of luck, but time is a-ticking, so you better get looking quick! Chop chop! (<= Get it? )

Okay, so I think that establishes the fact that I am a seriously funny guy (cough, cough).  In addition to such examples of comedic gold, I'd want you to know that I am a 31 year old man, currently single, who is Vegetarian, leaning towards becoming fully Vegan.  I love to cook, and as everyone who loves to cook knows, it's way better to cook for someone else, than just for yourself.

For that reason, I would be thrilled to have a roommate who is also Vegetarian, but don't take that as a deal-breaker.  And who knows, maybe I can get you to come over from the dark side ;)

I don't drink very often, and I don't drink very much when I do.  There would be no smoking of any substances INSIDE the place. Take that any way you see fit, because there are plenty of idyllic parks nearby.

I am a MAJOR NERD, and love to learn.  I also love to create, in a myriad of different mediums.  I am meeting a major need of mine by keeping my living quarters in harmonious order, so if you are very messy, and comfortable with staying messy, then I wish you the best of luck in finding a place elsewhere.

I  worship science, but I have first hand experience that the Universe winks at us in inexplicable ways, ergo, I am very open to spirituality in all the different forms that it can take.

Shoot me any further questions you might have! I will post indoor pictures as soon as I can, but for now you'll have to visualize it from the floor plan and the building's exterior (sorry, I know that's not ideal!)

Please contact me, either by e-mail or by phone!  show contact info
, the name's Rob.

House Title: I would like to rent a room on UBC campus
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Hi everyone! I’m Paul, from China , I will start my career as a visiting scholar at UBC in September.

I’m looking for Half-year accommodation ( 4th Sept 2019-28th Feb 2020) .The budget is around c $1,200 per month, and I’m hoping for a private bedroom (and private bathroom where available would also be extremely appreciated) in a house with one or more roommates (even with owner is considered), ideally no more than 20-30 mins from campus by public transports. Housemates can be either boys or girls (the latter is slightly preferred only because usually tidier).

Neighbourhoods considered are West Point Grey, Kitsilano, Dunbar and Kerrisdale.
Room and house MUST be furnished, have laundry, kitchen supplies and all the utilities included.
Room and house should preferably be bright and with lots of natural light.

I will arrive in Vancouver on September 4th, and looking for an immediate move if possible.

A bit about me: I’m 41-year-old, My research field is related to Environmental Finance (wrote two monographs). I have worked for the ministry of environmental protection and a provincial financial institution. I have both a registered environmental impact assessor and securities qualification certificate.

I like sports (tennis, golf and skiing), movies, and music (Released a popular single in China) . I love the outdoors, cycling and travelling (43 countries visited) . I adore nature and wildlife.  I'm neat, friendly and quite passionate.

I respect other's privacy just as I expect others to respect mine. I'm totally fine in chatting, having dinner together or watch some tv together. 
So please feel free to messatel me if you‘ve got a room free and are seeking a housemate!

House Title: Attention: Changemakers, Healers, Creatives
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Hello Hi,
I have a room available at the Pink Palace and am hoping to make some dreams come true by having the first participant in the Synergize Community Health and Business Incubator move in. I’m looking for Changemakers, Healers, and Creatives. Someone who loves community, and community building, and wants to create a source of income doing something they’re passionate about. Yoga, gym, socials, support and accountability in building your business will be yours and so much more if I choo, choo, choose you. (Bonus points if you know what tv show that’s from). The room available is in a 4 bedroom upper level suite In the Metrotown area shared with myself and one other roommate. The fourth room is a shared office space. It is a 7 minute walk to Metropolis mall and 13 minute walk to Metrotown and Patterson Skytrains. There are lots of places to dine out and two gyms in walking distance as well as a co-working space a block away. Please take a peak at www.synergizecommunity.com to see if this is something that aligns with your vision/lifestyle (This is a beta test of the incubator, so the 10% donation is optional. Please read website for details)
A little bit about myself = I've spent the last 2 years transitioning from the ECE (Early Childhood Education) field into wellness. In 2017 I did my Yoga 200hrs at Karma Teachers. Then in 2018 I did a chair massage course as well as a Thai Massage course. I am currently completing a Life Coaching course through Rhodes Wellness college. My life dream is to create a space for individuals to learn how to create sustenance by doing something that brings them joy (most of the time), as well as helping them create a healthy lifestyle. I will be the first person to journey through this incubator and I'm hoping you will join me.
If you are interested please reply with a little bit about yourself and why you think you would be a good fit.
Thanks :)
T

House Title: FURNISHED ALL INCLUSIVE | CAPITOL HILL MODERN LUXE RETREAT
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Welcome to your New Home in Capitol Hill near Burnaby Heights, easy access to SFU and minutes to downtown. This new 1 bedroom suite w/separate entrance features open concept floor plan w/1 bedroom/1 bath/full kitchen w/ contemporary design & stainless steel appliances. Hiking, swimming, cross fit or yoga are all minutes away from all the activities that this neighbourhood has to offer along with a mixture of delicious dining experience and shops. Enjoy all the Netflix movies & shows on your smart TV. 

RENTAL DETAILS:

- Fully Furnished + Includes Everything @ $1975/month 
- Min 1 Year Lease
- Damage Deposit: Half Month Rent
- No Pets
- References and Background Check is required
- Available Date: Flexible

THE SPACE | FULLY FURNISHED

Located in the prestigious Capitol Hill of Burnaby Heights near trendy Brentwood Park, SFU and minutes to downtown and N. Van. This new 1 bedroom lower suite with separate private entrance is all ready for you to call home.

Features include an open concept floor plan with 1 bd + very comfortable sofa bed, 1 bath, gourmet kitchen with contemporary design and top quality s/s appliances and fixtures. The space is approx. 600sqft with modern, simple decor and furnishings. There's a Bose Ipod dock for you to enjoy some tunes. All the details and decor are handpicked with love creating a comfortable and cozy home for you to enjoy.

Hiking, swimming, cross fit or yoga are all minutes away from all the activities that this neighborhood has to offer along with a mixture of delicious dining experience and shops. Enjoy all the latest HD & Netflix entertainment on your flat screen LED TV on lazy nights. 

WHAT'S INCLUDED:

- Kitchen Essentials
- Heating | Hot Water | Gas | Utilities
- Hangers | Iron
- TV | Cable | High-speed fiber optic internet
- Private entrance
- Laptop friendly workspace
- Nespresso Coffee Maker
- Bose Dock 
- Refrigerator | Microwave
- Dishes and silverware
- Cooking basics | Oven | Stove
- Free parking on premises
- Free street parking
- All Decorations and Furniture as seen in picture

THE NEIGHBORHOOD:

The Heights is a special place.

The Heights is one of the best-kept secrets in the Lower Mainland. With a strong sense of community and history, beautiful views, parks and trails, recreational amenities, and a thriving business district all within walking distance, on the Heights, life is as it should be.

Famous for its local eateries, the area is walking distance from major grocery stores, schools, parks, a local library, recreation center, and is a stone’s throw from Italian delis, bakeries, and coffee shops.

Local hotspots like Anton’s Pasta Bar, Cioffi’s Meat Market, Valley Bakery, and the Chez Meme Baguette Bistro have all maintained their status as local landmarks, and they are just a handful of the many businesses that carry a witty, small-town charm.

We are just up the hill from Eileen Dailly Park, Pool and Fitness Centre. We are minutes from buses and skytrain. SFU, BCIT, and the PNE are nearby. This area of North Burnaby is truly the perfect hub for all destinations in and around the Lower Mainland.

*****

If you're interested, please EMAIL with your phone number and some DETAILS about yourself and we'll get back to you soon! Thank you for your interest.

House Title: If you need sleep, be weary North of Burn Lake-Prod Way-Sperling
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


I think someone else may have posted this a little while ago, but just thought I'd help give a caution to folks renting or buying around here up from Burn Lake rail. It's horrible, shaking 17-24 hours a day from heavy and idling freight (mainly Coal) trains. It never stops. The acceleration or heavy braking will jolt you from your sleep repeatedly causing a spike in blood pressure and possible cardiac event. It's 4:14 am and they have been braking and idling now for 31.5 hours; no break. My family and I have lived here since the mid eighties. It was nice, peaceful, great trails etc. Now (since 2014) nobody ever sleeps and/or has vibroacoutic illness. Seriously, objects rattle in a home with a well insulated attic. It goes THROUGH earplugs. Your proximity doesn't need be all that close. We don't live very close. Back in 2014-2015, the federal government ruled that they could do pretty much anything they want without upgrading the actual rail to handle it. That's why there are soooo many derailments since then, workers dying etc.  
Good luck.

https://www.macleans.ca/news/canada/are-train-companies-railroading-canadian-communities/

House Title: SFU Loft With STUNNING Views
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


We have our amazing two-year-old loft located in UniverCity @ SFU available for rent. This two-level unit is the top two floors of the building and offers an unobstructed south-facing view with 18ft floor to ceiling windows that show stunning views of the Lower Mainland.

The apartment includes laminate flooring throughout, with carpet upstairs. The kitchen provides ample space for storage, as well as a microwave, dishwasher, and stove, and a large fridge with a freezer drawer. The spacious living room is large enough to incorporate a study area and not feel cramped. There are two closets in the bedroom, and enough room to fit a queen-sized bed, a dresser, and two nightstands.

Included in the cost of rent are all utilities, TELUS highspeed 150 MBPS internet, 1 parking stall (lots of visitor parking if a 2nd spot is needed), an oversized storage locker, fully equipped gym, as well as a multi-purpose room and lounge.

If getting around without a vehicle is a concern you needn’t worry. You’ll be living within steps from campus, and minutes away from express bus routes that will conveniently take you anywhere you want to. Be it Vancouver, Coquitlam, New West, or Burnaby it's easy to get to. Directly outside of the apartment is a bus that will have you down to Production Way in 15 minutes, and only 5 minutes away is the bus exchange which includes the 95 express bus that ends at Burrard Station.

The immediate surroundings also include Nesters Grocery Store, BC Liquor Store, Starbucks, Tim Horton’s, MINISO, Pearl Fever Tea House, CaliBurger, Uncle Fatih's pizza, and a whole lot more!

If a furnished apartment is part of your requirements we can certainly accommodate.  We can provide everything you need to just move right in.  All you’ll need is your suitcase (we provide the hangers)!  There will be an additional cost for having the place furnished, but we can discuss that upon meeting.

If you're looking to move in with a pet we’re open to them living there too!  An additional deposit would be required.

For viewings please get in touch with me directly to arrange a time.  If I don't answer please leave a message and I'll get back to you promptly.

We require a 1/2 month deposit, 12-month lease, and a credit check.

Thanks for your interest!

Insurance: Tenants are required to hold current tenant's insurance, proof of insurance will be required at move-in.

To rent this property applicants must complete a tenancy application in full, have an excellent Landlord reference and Tenancy history, agree to a Credit Check and have a Credit Score of at least 600, and proven sufficient income  that can support the rental rate.

Offshore applicants will also require a valid passport, work or student visa and be able to prove they can legally stay in Canada for the duration of the tenancy. A local guarantor may be required.

Pet Policy: Pets may or may not be allowed in this property, this is the decision of the Landlord/Owner and the Strata Corporation (if applicable). A deposit of 50% of the monthly rental rate is required along with references.

Smoking Policy: No smoking in any of the rental properties, no exceptions, this is grounds for eviction.

We do NOT charge an application or processing fee as per clause 15 of the Residential Tenancy Act.

Tenant Obligations Under the Residential Tenancy Act: A tenant must maintain reasonable health, cleanliness and sanitary standards throughout the rental unit and the other residential property to which the tenant has access.

A tenant of a rental unit must repair damage to the rental unit or common area that is caused by the actions or neglect of the tenant or a person permitted on the residential property by the tenant.

Tenancy Application Disclaimer: This application in no way forms a tenancy, it is an offer to rent, subject to the Landlords approval, based on the information supplied and other possible applicants and offers pending.

House Title: FURNISHED ALL INCLUSIVE - CAPITOL HILL MODERN LUXE RETREAT
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Welcome to your New Home in Capitol Hill near Burnaby Heights, easy access to SFU and minutes to downtown. This new 1 bedroom suite w/separate entrance features open concept floor plan w/1 bedroom/1 bath/full kitchen w/ contemporary design & stainless steel appliances. Hiking, swimming, cross fit or yoga are all minutes away from all the activities that this neighbourhood has to offer along with a mixture of delicious dining experience and shops. Enjoy all the Netflix movies & shows on your smart TV. 

RENTAL DETAILS:

- Fully Furnished + Includes Everything @ $1975/month 
- Min 1 Year Lease
- Damage Deposit: Half Month Rent
- No Pets
- References and Background Check is required
- Available Date: Flexible

THE SPACE | FULLY FURNISHED

Located in the prestigious Capitol Hill of Burnaby Heights near trendy Brentwood Park, SFU and minutes to downtown and N. Van. This new 1 bedroom lower suite with separate private entrance is all ready for you to call home.

Features include an open concept floor plan with 1 bd + very comfortable sofa bed, 1 bath, gourmet kitchen with contemporary design and top quality s/s appliances and fixtures. The space is approx. 600sqft with modern, simple decor and furnishings. There's a Bose Ipod dock for you to enjoy some tunes. All the details and decor are handpicked with love creating a comfortable and cozy home for you to enjoy.

Hiking, swimming, cross fit or yoga are all minutes away from all the activities that this neighborhood has to offer along with a mixture of delicious dining experience and shops. Enjoy all the latest HD & Netflix entertainment on your flat screen LED TV on lazy nights. 

WHAT'S INCLUDED:

- Kitchen Essentials
- Heating | Hot Water | Gas | Utilities
- Hangers | Iron
- TV | Cable | High-speed fiber optic internet
- Private entrance
- Laptop friendly workspace
- Nespresso Coffee Maker
- Bose Dock 
- Refrigerator | Microwave
- Dishes and silverware
- Cooking basics | Oven | Stove
- Free parking on premises
- Free street parking
- All Decorations and Furniture as seen in picture

THE NEIGHBORHOOD:

The Heights is a special place.

The Heights is one of the best-kept secrets in the Lower Mainland. With a strong sense of community and history, beautiful views, parks and trails, recreational amenities, and a thriving business district all within walking distance, on the Heights, life is as it should be.

Famous for its local eateries, the area is walking distance from major grocery stores, schools, parks, a local library, recreation center, and is a stone’s throw from Italian delis, bakeries, and coffee shops.

Local hotspots like Anton’s Pasta Bar, Cioffi’s Meat Market, Valley Bakery, and the Chez Meme Baguette Bistro have all maintained their status as local landmarks, and they are just a handful of the many businesses that carry a witty, small-town charm.

We are just up the hill from Eileen Dailly Park, Pool and Fitness Centre. We are minutes from buses and skytrain. SFU, BCIT, and the PNE are nearby. This area of North Burnaby is truly the perfect hub for all destinations in and around the Lower Mainland.

*****

If you're interested, please EMAIL with your phone number and some DETAILS about yourself and we'll get back to you soon! Thank you for your interest.

House Title: International Students or home stay
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


We have a furnished four bedroom suite with full kitchen, a big sunroom, dining room, living room, two bathrooms and a laundry room ready for an international student. (Home Stay welcome) The whole place is about 2200 sf and each bedroom is about 12 by 12 feet. Each has a bed, desk, closet with drawers and a lamp. It's an amazing house with it's own private entrance from the side yard and a private driveway. The parking on driveway and garage is limited, only 1 more parking is available for the moment, so we are looking for students who use public transportation (there is a bus stop right outside the house on Burris St. that takes you to Metrotown, SFU, Edmund sky train station Douglas college or New West skytrain station, or BCIT and Brentwood mall in the opposite direction )
The reason we are looking for international students is that we don't want any party animals running wild away from parents, but if you are serious about your studies and are Registered students we would be ok with you too, but there is ABSOLUTELY no smoking and drugs allowed in, around or even away from the house.
You must be a respectful, well mannered, and know how to clean after yourself to apply, there is a rotating list of chores like vacuuming, toilet clean up.
We are a couple living in the same place, very quite and exceptionally clean. There’s tenant living in the basement so please keep the noice down always. There is TV with cable and WiFi for your use as well as basic kitchen utensils. Washer and dryer is in the garage.
There is ONE person per room policy and the rent is $650 for each bedroom.
There are currently two rooms available and one is for visiting guest use. Very seldom we have friends or relatives staying overnight. So there’s only 4 person sharing the 2200 sf upper level house (with mountain view) plus a 3500 sf landscaped backyard for you to enjoy.  available from August 1st. 
Please call or text me for an appointment.

House Title: JUST RENOVATED 2 BED 2 BATH CORNER VIEW SUITE
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


This spacious 2 bedroom 2 full bathroom corner apartment on the top floor has a wonderful view to the north, east and even west ie sunsets and mountains.  It feels more like a house than an apartment.  Located on the rear of the building, it is quiet and private.  This well layed out suite has many closets and has just been renovated with new light coloured laminate and vinyl flooring in the kitchen and bathrooms. The living room is large and is easy to lay out your furniture.  It would be great for a working couple where you each want your own bathroom.  The dining room window faces east.  There is a patio off the living room that faces north with a mountain view.  This suite has great light all day.  

This suite has 2 full bathrooms including a tub/shower in each – you don’t often see this.

The spacious master bedroom easily fits a king sized bed and still has room for a dresser.  There are 2 large closets in the master bedroom and an ensuite bathroom.   The smaller second bedroom is large enough to accommodate a queen bed and would be great for a guest room or could be an office. The main bathroom has a large closet for towels and toiletries.  The kitchen has a brand new full size range and a brand new fridge with new countertops and a double stainless steel sink.

House Title: Furnished Room for Rent Near New Westminster SkyTrain Station
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Room for rent available September, 2019: $800 per month

I am a female working professional looking for a student or young working professional as a roommate. Our apartment is a spacious, bright (Southeast facing) 4br near the water, and right in between New Westminster SkyTrain station and Steel & Oak brewery! Looking for a clean, respectful individual to rent a furnished room, 6 month term preferred but flexible rental term available. 

This is a private, furnished room (includes single bed, desk, bookshelf, built-in closet, mirror, chair, with linens and towels provided). There is 1 common bathroom shared between 3 roommates. Kitchen, living room, balcony and BBQ, and in-suite laundry are shared between all 4 roommates. 

Wifi and all utilities (electricity, heating, hot water, etc.) are included in the rent. You will also have access to all the building amenities! Includes: indoor swimming pool, hot tub, sauna, exercise gym, library, games room, bike storage, visitor parking, and ability to rent the guest suite. I also have a parking stall available for $50 per month if you drive. 

The apartment is located within walking distance to New Westminster Quay, grocery stores, restaurants, and transit (bus and skytrain).  
- 8 min walk to New Westminster skytrain station (Expo line), Quay restaurants & shops, cinema, Pier Park 
- 2 min walk to the waterfront (Fraser River)

We are 3 working professionals/students looking for a fourth person to be our roommate. We are clean and respectful roommates from different educational and cultural backgrounds. We are really friendly and look forward to getting to know you!

House Title: Attention: Changemakers, Healers, Creatives
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Hello Hi,
I have a room available at the Pink Palace and am hoping to make some dreams come true by having the first participant in the Synergize Community Health and Business Incubator move in.  I’m looking for Changemakers, Healers, and Creatives.  Someone who loves community, and community building, and wants to create a source of income doing something they’re passionate about.  Yoga, gym, socials, support and accountability in building your business will be yours and so much more if I choo, choo, choose you.  (Bonus points if you know what tv show that’s from).  The room available is in a 4 bedroom upper level suite In the Metrotown area shared with myself and one other roommate.  The fourth room is a shared office space.  It is a  7 minute walk to Metropolis mall and 13 minute walk to Metrotown and Patterson Skytrains. There are lots of places to dine out and two gyms in walking distance as well as a co-working space a block away. Please take a peak at www.synergizecommunity.com to see if this is something that aligns with your vision/lifestyle (This is a beta test of the incubator, so the 10% donation is optional.  Please read website for details)
A little bit about myself = I've spent the last 2 years transitioning from the ECE (Early Childhood Education) field into wellness.  In 2017 I did my Yoga 200hrs at Karma Teachers.  Then in 2018 I did a chair massage course as well as a Thai Massage course.  I am currently completing a Life Coaching course through Rhodes Wellness college.  My life dream is to create a space for individuals to learn how to create sustenance by doing something that brings them joy (most of the time), as well as helping them create a healthy lifestyle.  I will be the first person to journey through this incubator and I'm hoping you will join me.
If you are interested please reply with a little bit about yourself and why you think you would be a good fit.
Thanks :)
T

House Title: Westcoast Style, Beautiful View, Capitol Hill
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


The renovations done to this FULLY FURNISHED Greater Vancouver  area home were inspired by the owner’s many vacations in the beautiful West Coast styled properties of Whistler BC. This older home has been warmly renovated with real hardwood floors and cabinets and beautiful fir beams and french doors.  Fully framed glass doors open to amazing outdoor deck space looking over the Burrard inlet and Belcarra park. The home boasts fantastic  views  of Mount Baker,  sweeping across for 270 degrees site lines.  When you wake up in the expansive master bedroom you feel like you are living outdoors with the ocean and mountains sprawling out in front of you, while you sip your morning coffee made at the in-room coffee bar. 

This Burnaby home has four bedrooms, two bathrooms and full kitchen, dining and living room over two floors. The owner will keep the private basement suite for personal use on an alternating week basis. The front driveway and shed will be available for tenant’s storage needs and the owner will keep the garage out back. 

The home is walking distance to the Hastings Express B Line meaning you can get downtown or up to SFU faster than driving. 25 mins downtown or 10 mins to SFU. A short five min walk to bus.

The home has immaculately cared for gardens and flower pots, and a ping pong table and a trampoline, making outdoor living even more enjoyable. The gardens and pots have a fully automatic sprinkler system and the owner will continue the outdoor maintenance during the tenure of this home.

House Title: $600 1 room available in a 2 bedroom basement suite near SFU
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Room available in the basement suite of a large house in Burnaby, less than 2 miles from SFU campus. 

Currently there are three people living in the basement suite. My roommate is moving out at the end of July, leaving the room that is shown in the pictures open (it will be cleaned prior to your move in date). I will be moving out on August 14th, which means that you (the new roommate!) will ultimately be sharing the space only with other roommate (male in late 20's). There is a wonderful beagle named Duke that frequents the basement suite, so DOG LOVERS PREFERRED. 

The rent is $600.00 per month for the small room or $700.00 for the big room, with a $300.00 refundable security deposit. The lease is month to month.

Both single occupancy and couples are allowed, although the price will go up with couples according to our landlord’s request (ask about this option if you are interested). We live in a beautiful and safe neighborhood with lots of dogs and parks nearby. Right across the street is a nice trail to go for walks or runs on. You are only a 10-15 minute walk away from Greystone Plaza with Hop & Vine, SuperValue, Liquor store, Vet, Dentist, and Shoppers. You will be right on the 136 bus line, which is about a 30 minute bus ride to Simon Fraser university, or a 45 minute walk along nature trails. The house is conveniently located to a skytrain station. It is a 15 minute walk to Lake City Way skytrain station. Going downtown from the house is about 40 minutes. 

If you drive, there is plenty of parking on the street. 

There is a living room, kitchen (with stove, fridge, oven and dishwasher), and one full bathroom. 

The rent includes:
- Utilities (hydro and heat)
- Washer and dryer
- Hi-speed internet (WiFi)

Text or email back with questions or for a viewing.
(77eight-nine57-nineteen45)

Looking forward to meeting you!

To the southeast, a vista over the city all the way to Mount Baker in Washington state, and to the southwest a permanent view of the Central Park forest. Enjoy the stunning view from your 30-foot tiled terrace, which is perfect for BBQing, entertaining and just plain relaxation! Great concrete building with a proactive and savvy strata.

Live across the street from a serene forest with 8.5 kilometers of trails for biking and walking, as well as general recreational facilities. Play pitch and putt golf, or walk to Metrotown, the third-largest shopping mall in Canada with over 450 shops and services, restaurants and 8 movie theatres. With Patterson SkyTrain station only a quick walk down the street, you can be at Waterfront in downtown Vancouver in less than 20 minutes, hassle-free. You'll be in the heart of Greater Vancouver with quick and easy access to major routes in all directions. It doesn't get more convenient than this!

House Title: Social room, Landscaped rooftop deck, Elevator
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Discover Novare, a 26-storey luxury rental apartment tower in the heart of historic downtown New Westminster. This vibrant and rapidly growing community has all the amenities you need close at hand, and is an easy commute to downtown Vancouver. At Realstar’s Novare, you’ll feel right at home in these modern, spacious apartments.

Our location
Novare has plenty of public transportation to choose from. There are two SkyTrain stations conveniently located within the immediate area—the Columbia Station is a half-block, 3-minute walk to the east; the New Westminster Station is a 5-minute walk to the west. The SkyTrain travel time to Downtown Vancouver’s Waterfront Station is only 25 minutes. Major bus routes run along Sixth Street, Columbia Street, Royal Avenue, and Eighth Street. Novare is close to the main shopping area in downtown where you’ll find numerous restaurants, coffee shops and shopping malls, as well as schools, medical clinics, and pharmacies. Notable highlights of the area include Douglas College, the Anvil Centre, the Law Courts, City Hall and the waterfront Westminster Pier Park.

Our suites
Novare offers stylish new studio, one-and two-bedroom apartments, as well as three-bedroom townhouse units up to 1,350 sq. ft. The apartments feature an appliance package that includes a Whirlpool fridge, stove, microwave, dishwasher, plus in-suite washer and dryer for your convenience. 

Our perks
Residents can enjoy the perks of an amenity room on the 6th level with various patio areas and a landscaped rooftop deck. A fitness facility is located on the 2nd floor and the underground parkade provides parking for residents and visitors, and also offers bicycle storage stalls for an additional fee. We are partnered with Modo car share and as a resident you well receive a $100 incentive towards your membership. You will feel secure living here with a fob entry system and on-site management who ensure that all your needs are met.

House Title: Commercial Kitchen
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Welcome to: Crosstown Food Services 

We have space for rent in a "Fraser Health" approved commercial kitchen or certified food production facility for part time or full time use. Great for any start up or small scale manufacturing. We have commercial grade equipment such as convection ovens, stoves, sinks, ice machine, various size steam kettles, tilt skillet, deep fryer, piston filler, prep tables, walk-in cooler and freezer. Plus space for your specialty equipment, supplies and storage. 

In addition we have a hot glue box sealer, tray sealer, bottle labeller and shrink wrap equipment for your packaging needs. We can help you source items in the supply chain to drive down your input costs.

We provide consulting for all the new CFIA initiative "Safe Food for Canadians Regulations" effective January 15th, 2019. Compliance guidance for the new mandatory food safety plan, food safety best practices, shelf life micro-testing, nutritional chart analysis, packaging and labeling requirements.

In addition we have an in-house packaging department from design, printing to manufacturing small boxes. This will drive down your packaging costs while in the testing phase, initial launch or product development. 

So from one foodie to another, how can we help you in your food adventure ?

House Title: Single room in 3 bedroom apartment
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


I am looking for a female (preferably) to rent a room in a three bedroom apartment. The apartment is a 10 minute bus ride, or a 5 minute drive to Simon Fraser University. We are also located 15 minutes walking distance from Kensington Shopping plaza, which has a safeway, liquor store, shoppers drugs mart, and various restaurants. If you transit, there are several buses that you can catch with in short walking distance and include: the 95B line, 144 metrotown stn/ SFU and the 160 Poco/ Kootney loop. 

About us: Currently this apartment has two females in our late 20s and early 30s. I am currently a Student at SFU, studying Criminology, and are both employed full time. We are super out going and friendly individuals and are looking for someone who is equally outgoing and isn't going to hide out in their room all the time. That said obviously personal space is important and we are very respectful of that. 

Unfortunately this is not a party house and we are not looking for couples. You are free to have people over, but you need to be respectful of the fact that we often have to be up early for school/ work and I often study at home. That said we do have drinks together and friends over, so we're not as strict as we sound. If you're looking for a place to party every night, this is definitely not the place for you. 

I already have a cat, and unfortunately she doesn't get along with other cats very well. Because of this there can be no other pets. She is a lovely cat though and everyone seems to love her, so hopefully you will too. 

The apartment is fully furnished and internet and hydro are included in the rental amount which is $430.00 a month. 

There are coin operated washers and dryers on site. Street Parking is available for free and parking in the lot is $30 a month, I believe. I’ll have to double check that.

House Title: Compassionate, responsible and friendly person looking for a new home
House Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Hi there.   My name is Michael and I am a full-time professional looking for a lovely home in a difficult housing city.  All of my fingers and toes are crossed! :)   What you will notice about me is that I am friendly, but also very respectful of space.  I enjoy my quiet time as well as engaging in shared conversation, as I value communication.  I do not party, or smoke or do recreational drugs.  I come without pets, but I do have a few plants and some loved ukuleles (all well-cared for).  I clean up after myself and my surroundings without prompting, because my parents raised me to be a polite and courteous human.  My rent is paid on time always by post-dated cheques.  I am looking for something unfurnished as I already have a comfortable bed I could never part with.  My preference would be anywhere close to a Skytrain (East Van, Burnaby, New West).  
I live a compassionate, encouraging and caring life.  I hope to find a new home, where that could benefit the household.  To be a new friend rather than just a tenant.  Please feel free to ask me any questions you might have.  Thank you for taking the time to read this! :))

Hello,

Host Families Needed at Eurocentres Vancouver!

Are you interested in learning about other cultures? Would you like to open your home to people from other countries? 

We’re looking for friendly families or couples who are looking to participate in lives of international students and want to be a part of helping us build our excellent global reputation. 

Even if you are only available during the summer months, please reach out!

You must provide:
-	A private room with a bed, dresser, desk and lamp
-	A maximum of a 50 minute commute to UBC
-	A home environment where predominantly English is spoken
-	3 complete meals per day
-	A maximum of four international students, all from different language backgrounds, and of the same gender
-	Treatment as part of your family to make the students’ Canadian experience as enjoyable as possible!

Our main school for adult students is located a 5 minute walk from Waterfront Station in downtown Vancouver and hosts student from over 40 different countries! We also run a summer junior program at UBC’s Point Grey campus for students ages 12-17. For adult full board students, we pay $30/night and for junior full board students in the summertime, we pay $32/night.
